SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

eu.threecixty.privacy.datastorage
Interface ProfileManagerFactory

public interface ProfileManagerFactory

 try {
 // PlainCredentialProfileFactory is a dummy factory where authentication is based on plain text credentials.
 ProfileManagerFactory factory = new PlainCredentialProfileFactory();
 ProfileManager mgr = factory.getProfileManager("/etc/profilemanager.cfg");
 
 // To get a session we need an authenticator
 Service service = factory.getService(serviceID, serviceAuth);
 
 // Get the authenticator token
 Properties protocolExtra = new Properties();
 // Add here required extras for authentication protocol if necessary
 Authenticator auth = factory.getAuthenticator(service, "bob", "bob-is-marley", protocolExtra);
 
 // Now open the session with the authenticator
 Session session = mgr.getSession(auth);
 if (session != null) {
   // The session is now opened.
   mgr.getProfileStatus(session, user)
 } else {
   // Authentication failure.
 }
 } catch (SecurityException security) {
 } catch (Exception e) {
 }

Method Summary
 Authenticator getAuthenticator(Service service, java.lang.String user, java.lang.String auth, java.util.Properties protocolOptions)
          Obtain an Authenticator token in order to establish a Session for a user and requester service.

Method Detail

getProfileManager

ProfileManager getProfileManager(java.lang.String confFilePath)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Create a ProfileManager using a specified configuration or get an existing ProfileManager.

Parameters:
confFilePath - the path of the configuration file for the ProfileManager to get
Returns:
a valid ProfileManager
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getService

Service getService(java.lang.String serviceID,
                   java.lang.String serviceAuth)
                   throws java.lang.SecurityException
Identify and authenticate a service.

Parameters:
serviceID - the identifier of the service
serviceAuth - the authentication information for the service
Returns:
if the service is authenticated, this method returns a Service token to be passed to getAuthenticator(Service, String, String, Properties)
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the service cannot be identified or authenticated.

getAuthenticator

Authenticator getAuthenticator(Service service,
                               java.lang.String user,
                               java.lang.String auth,
                               java.util.Properties protocolOptions)
                               throws java.lang.SecurityException
Obtain an Authenticator token in order to establish a Session for a user and requester service.

Parameters:
service - an authenticated service, which should have been obtained with getService(String, String) beforehand.
user - the user identifier. Pass an empty string for anonymous user. Null is not permitted.
auth - the authentication information for the user. Pass an empty string for an anonymous user. Null is not permitted.
protocolOptions - optional information for management of the authentication. This parameter can be null.
Returns:
if the user is authenticated or is anonymous, this method returns an Authenticator holding the information about the authenticated user and service that can be passed to getAuthenticator(Service, String, String, Properties) to open a session for this user and service.
Throws:
java.lang.SecurityException - if the user cannot be identified or authenticated.
